titleStmt.title: Robert R. Farris et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency
Thos E Bramlette

We, the undersigned citizens of Livingston County, would respectfully represent, that one of J J Baxter was indicted at the last term of this Court for detaining one Penelope Johnson a white woman, about Eighteen years of age, against her will with intent to Commit rape on her person. Miss Johnson was & is a woman, of high respectablity and full faith Can be given to her evidence, Besides she was fully Corroborated by all of the evidence in the case. After full argument, the Jury convicted said Baxter and sentenced him to confinement in the Penitentiary for two years. We respectfully remonstrate against any pardon being granted said Baxter. Respectfully

Robert R. Farris of the Jury
E. B. Simen
Alexr Davis
W M Gray
G C Moxley
I. C. Davis
G. G. Aydelott
William Haley
William ^his X mark^ Stewart

James. H. Nash
